primary_diagnosis.justification: Based on the patient's history indicating previous episodes, confirming the recurrent specifier. Current symptoms are ongoing and impactful, necessitating the initiation of *Sertraline* 4 weeks ago. The severity is currently mapped to moderate based on the clinical impact and provider feedback.
dsm_criteria_met: A. Meets criteria for current Major Depressive Episode.
B. History confirms recurrence (at least one previous MDE).
E. Absence of manic or hypomanic episodes.

ruled_out.description: Major depressive disorder, single episode, moderate
ruled_out.reason: History confirms previous episodes, negating the 'single episode' specifier.

ruled_out.description: Bipolar I disorder, current episode depressed, mild
ruled_out.reason: The patient explicitly denies any history of manic or hypomanic episodes, ruling out Bipolar spectrum disorders.
Clinical presentation suggests episodic, recurrent Major Depressive Disorder rather than chronic, low-grade symptoms lasting two or more years.
